line_1: " Their heavenly notes each tuneful planet rolls!
line_2: " Shall drown in deep delight their raptur'd souls!

line_1: No Whaly Monster here destructive rolls,
line_2: No Robber comes that preys on weaker Shoals.

line_1: While o'er the Floods the wanton Dolphin rolls,
line_2: All give the Sea, and drive their mingled Shoals.

line_1: "For o'er thy head the dark cloud rolls,
line_2: How deep the angry tempest growls

line_1: Calls to the Good and Brave with voice, that rolls
line_2: Like Heaven's own thunder round the echoing poles;

line_1: And the vast surface kindles, as it rolls!
line_2: LIFE buds or breathes from Indus to the Poles,

line_1: Stripp'd of her pride the vessel rolls,
line_2: The secret anguish of our souls,

line_1: Stripp'd of her pride the vessel rolls,
" Swift as the Wheel of Nature rolls
line_2: "I'de fly to meet and mingle Souls,

line_1: And far as Wind can blow, or Water rolls,
line_2: Torrid and Frigid scale, and joyn the Poles,

line_1: Then to the Park where Claudia rolls
line_2: Her Eyes to fish for shallow Souls:

line_1: Th' archbishop and the master of the rolls?
line_2: Neither is young, and one's as old as Paul's.

line_1: When round the Heart its smiling Phantom rolls;
line_2: Tho' pictur'd Joy deludes our panting Souls,

line_1: Shrill through this hollow vault it rolls!
line_2: "Hark! that loud bell which sullen tolls!

line_1: But whilst in Floods our Sorrow rolls,
line_2: This dear Delight of Mingling Souls

line_1: Ye nymphs that pine o'er chocolate and rolls,
line_2: Hence take fresh bloom, fresh vigour to your souls.
